4:
For they have no pain until their death,
\q but they are strong and well fed.
\q
7:
Out of such blindness comes sin;
\q evil thoughts pass through their hearts.
9:
They set their mouth against the heavens,
\q and their tongues march through the earth.
10:
Therefore his people turn to them
\q and abundant waters are drained out.
\q
11:
They say, "How does God know?
\q Is there knowledge with the Most High?"
\q
12:
Take notice: these people are wicked;
\q they are always carefree, becoming richer and richer.
13:
Surely it is in vain that I have guarded my heart
\q and washed my hands in innocence.
\q
14:
For all the day long I have been afflicted
\q and disciplined every morning.
\q
15:
If I had said, "I will say these things,"
\q then I would have betrayed this generation of your children.
16:
Though I tried to understand these things,
\q it was too difficult for me.
\q
17:
Then I went into God's sanctuary
\q and came to understand their fate.
19:
How they become a wilderness in a moment!
\q They come to an end and are finished in awful terrors.
\q
20:
They are like a dream after one wakes up;
\q2 Lord, when you arise, you will think nothing of those dreams.
21:
For my heart was grieved,
\q and I was deeply wounded.
\q
22:
I was ignorant and lacked insight;
\q I was like a senseless animal before you.
24:
You will guide me with your advice
\q and afterward receive me to glory.
25:
Whom have I in heaven but you?
\q There is no one on earth that I desire but you.
\q
26:
My flesh and my heart grow weak,
\q but God is the strength of my heart forever.
27:
Those who are far from you will perish;
\q you will destroy all those who are unfaithful
to you.
\q
28:
But as for me, all I need to do is to approach God.
\q I have made the Lord Yahweh my refuge.
\q I will declare all your deeds.
